bibl.title: Letter from Calvin H. Goddard to Laura Armistead Carter, September 18, 1925

div1.p: Goddard expresses sympathy upon the death of Henry Carter.

div1.head: Letter from Calvin H. Goddard to Laura Armistead Carter, September 18, 1925
div1.opener:
TELEPHONES: MADISON SQUARE 0772
5470
CABLE: “BUFORSAL” NEW YORK
BUREAU OF FORENSIC BALLISTICS
4 East Twenty-Eighth Street
New York City
September 18th, 1925.
CHARLES E. WAITE
CALVIN H. GODDARD
PHILIP O. GRAVELLE
JOHN H. FISHER
Dear Laura-
div1.p:
Lilie tells me that she saw you at Ashland at your father's burial.
I am so glad she was able to be there. And I am so glad for him and for
you that the terrible strain is over. It was high true for both of you
to take up new lives.
Possibly the World will someday realize its loss.
